Criteria.Question 1:
What is your understanding of this role based on the job description?
• 1*
  Vague/generic statements not related to JD
  No reference to EDF Trading/ energy/commodities sector
  No mention of trading, risk, analytics
  No mention of global presence or values
  No mention of their 'what we are looking for' section (critical thinking, quant & qual analytical skills, interpersonal skills, programming)
• 2*
  Mentions EDF Trading/energy/commodities but not in depth at all or clarity
  Picks out 1-2 role elements but not linking it to the actual JD
  No real mention of the opportunities (real business project, industry knowledge, networking, coaching from leaders/managers)
  Mentions some of the skills from 'what we are looking for' section, but doesn't apply it to the job/company
  Limited/no understanding of the internship structure/goals
• 3*
  Demonstrates OK/general grasp of EDF Trading within energy markets
  Mentions relevant areas of the business that internship will cover (trading, risk, analytics), but no detail
  Mentions company values
  Mentions some of the opportunities (real business project, industry knowledge, networking, coaching from leaders/managers), but not in a lot of detail
  Mentions about a place on the commercial grad scheme, but not a lot of motivations coming through
• 4*
  Clearly articulate EDF Trading's position in global energy markets
  Talks about specific areas of the business - power, gas, LNG, risk management, analytics - showing having done more research
  Clearly understands the internship structure and opportunities: real business project, industry knowledge, networking, coaching from leaders/managers
  Connecting their skills to the JD (programming and critical thinking)
  References our values/culture in their answers
• 5*
  Extensive/comprehensive summary of the role and EDF Trading
  Shows deep insight into how internship can contribute to EDFT
  Talks in (some) detail around different commodities (LNG, LPG) and/or functions (origination, quant risk etc)
  Aligns their background/skills to the role's expectations (programming, commercial awareness etc)
  Mentions place on grad programme with desire (interns) and job offer at end (grads)
Criteria.Question 2:
Why do you want to work for EDF Trading?
• 1*
  Generic statements about 'trading' or 'energy' without specific reference to EDF Trading
  No clear link between their interests and the company's activities
  No mention of specific aspects of the internship (e.g., real business project, industry knowledge)
  Focuses solely on personal gain without considering contribution to EDFT
• 2*
  Mentions EDF Trading but lacks depth or specific reasons for interest
  Connects to 1-2 general aspects of the role but not the unique opportunities
  Limited understanding of EDF Trading's market position or values
  Some mention of personal development but not how it aligns with EDFT's goals
• 3*
  Demonstrates a general understanding of EDF Trading's role in energy markets
  Mentions relevant areas of the business (e.g., power, gas, risk) and links to personal interest
  Acknowledges some internship opportunities (e.g., real project, networking) but without much detail
  Shows some motivation for a place on the commercial grad scheme
• 4*
  Clearly articulates EDF Trading's position in global energy markets and specific reasons for interest
  Highlights specific aspects of the internship (e.g., real business project, industry knowledge, coaching) and how they align with personal goals
  Connects personal skills/background to EDFT's values and culture
  Expresses a strong desire for a place on the commercial grad scheme
• 5*
  Extensive and comprehensive summary of interest in EDF Trading and the internship
  Shows deep insight into how the internship can contribute to EDFT's objectives
  Talks in detail about specific commodities (LNG, LPG) or functions (origination, quant risk) and how they relate to their aspirations
  Aligns their background/skills to the role's expectations (e.g., programming, commercial awareness) and demonstrates a clear fit
  Mentions a strong desire for a place on the grad program and a long-term career at EDFT
Criteria.Question 3:
What is it about this Internship position that stands out for you?
• 1*
  Lists generic skills without providing specific examples or linking them to the internship
  No mention of critical thinking, quantitative/qualitative analytical skills, interpersonal skills, or programming
  Experiences are irrelevant or not clearly articulated
  Fails to demonstrate how their background aligns with the job description
• 2*
  Mentions 1-2 relevant skills (e.g., analytical) but provides weak or no examples
  Some attempt to link skills to the role but lacks conviction or detail
  Experiences are somewhat relevant but not clearly demonstrating capability
  Limited understanding of the 'what we are looking for' section
• 3*
  Demonstrates a general understanding of required skills (e.g., critical thinking, analytical)
  Provides some relevant examples, but they may lack depth or direct applicability
  Mentions programming or interpersonal skills but without strong evidence
  Shows an OK grasp of how their experiences could be relevant to the internship
• 4*
  Clearly articulates 3-4 key skills (e.g., critical thinking, quant/qual analysis, programming, interpersonal)
  Provides strong, specific examples that directly relate to the internship responsibilities
  Demonstrates how their experiences have prepared them for the challenges of the role
  Clearly connects their skills to the 'what we are looking for' section of the JD
• 5*
  Extensive and comprehensive demonstration of all key skills (critical thinking, quant/qual analysis, interpersonal, programming)
  Provides compelling, detailed examples that showcase exceptional capability and direct relevance to EDFT's work
  Shows deep insight into how their unique experiences will contribute significantly to the internship project and team
  Aligns their background/skills perfectly with the role's expectations and EDFT's values
